H0.text: Fire is the change most likely to be slow among changes that can be fast or slow.

H1.text: Flood is the most likely slowest change among the given changes, as some changes occur rapidly while others occur slowly.

H2.text: Landslide is the most likely slowest change among changes that can be fast or slow.

H3.text: Drought is the change that is most likely the slowest among changes that can be fast or slow.

A4.text: Clay and silt slides are usually slow but can experience episodic acceleration in response to heavy rainfall or rapid snowmelt.

A5.text: Earthflows can move at speeds within a very wide range, from as low as 1 mm/yr to many km/h.
